original_solution_mapping.L1: He had 5 Kit-Kats and had 3 times that amount in Kisses so he had 5*3 = <<5*3=15>>15 Hershey kisses
original_solution_mapping.L2: He had 10 Baby Ruths and half that amount in Reese Peanut butter cups so he had 10/2 = <<10/2=5>>5 Reese Peanut Butter cups
original_solution_mapping.L3: He had 11 lollipops and gave 5 to his sister so he now had 11-5 = <<11-5=6>>6 lollipops
original_solution_mapping.L4: When you add up all of the candy, he had 5 Kit-Kats, 15 Hershey kisses, 10 Baby Ruths, 5 Reese cups, 8 Nerds and 6 lollipops so 5+15+10+5+8+6 = <<5+15+10+5+8+6=49>>49 pieces of candy

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 4844.
    Returns: the total number of pieces of candy Brent had left.
    """
    # L1
    kit_kat_bars = 5 # 5 Kit-Kat bars
    kisses_multiplier = 3 # three times that amount in Hershey kisses
    hershey_kisses = kit_kat_bars * kisses_multiplier

    # L2
    baby_ruths = 10 # 10 Baby Ruths
    reese_divisor = 2 # half that amount in Reese Peanut butter cups
    reese_cups = baby_ruths / reese_divisor

    # L3
    initial_lollipops = 11 # 11 lollipops
    lollipops_given_away = 5 # giving his little sister 5 lollipops
    remaining_lollipops = initial_lollipops - lollipops_given_away

    # L4
    nerds_boxes = 8 # 8 boxes of Nerds
    total_candy = kit_kat_bars + hershey_kisses + baby_ruths + reese_cups + nerds_boxes + remaining_lollipops

    # FA
    answer = total_candy
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He had {kit_kat_bars} Kit-Kats and had {kisses_multiplier} times that amount in Kisses so he had {kit_kat_bars}*{kisses_multiplier} = <<{kit_kat_bars}*{kisses_multiplier}={hershey_kisses}>>{hershey_kisses} Hershey kisses

He had {baby_ruths} Baby Ruths and half that amount in Reese Peanut butter cups so he had {baby_ruths}/{reese_divisor} = <<{baby_ruths}/{reese_divisor}={reese_cups}>>{reese_cups} Reese Peanut Butter cups

He had {initial_lollipops} lollipops and gave {lollipops_given_away} to his sister so he now had {initial_lollipops}-{lollipops_given_away} = <<{initial_lollipops}-{lollipops_given_away}={remaining_lollipops}>>{remaining_lollipops} lollipops

When you add up all of the candy, he had {kit_kat_bars} Kit-Kats, {hershey_kisses} Hershey kisses, {baby_ruths} Baby Ruths, {reese_cups} Reese cups, {nerds_boxes} Nerds and {remaining_lollipops} lollipops so {kit_kat_bars}+{hershey_kisses}+{baby_ruths}+{reese_cups}+{nerds_boxes}+{remaining_lollipops} = <<{kit_kat_bars}+{hershey_kisses}+{baby_ruths}+{reese_cups}+{nerds_boxes}+{remaining_lollipops}={total_candy}>>{total_candy} pieces of candy

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: He had 5 Kit-Kats and had 3 times that amount in Kisses so he had 5*3 = <<5*3=15>>15 Hershey kisses
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He had 10 Baby Ruths and half that amount in Reese Peanut butter cups so he had 10/2 = <<10/2=20>>20 Reese Peanut Butter cups
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: He had 11 lollipops and gave 5 to his sister so he now had 11-5 = <<11-5=6>>6 lollipops
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: When you add up all of the candy, he had 5 Kit-Kats, 15 Hershey kisses, 10 Baby Ruths, 20 Reese cups, 8 Nerds and 6 lollipops so 5+15+10+20+8+6 = <<5+15+10+20+8+6=64>>64 pieces of candy

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '/' but used '*' instead.
